Title: Design of Knowledge Management System in PT Premier Oil Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Authors with affiliations: Sutriyono, A., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Elidjen, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper is made with purpose to assess Knowledge Management Maturity in the PT Premier Oil Indonesia, so the company know what level they have and propose suggestion as an improvement for a rise to a higher level or the highest level. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: application; design; development; Knowledge Management System (KMS)
Index Keywords: Applications; Design; Information management; Knowledge based systems; development; Indonesia; Knowledge management system; Knowledge management
References: Debowski, S., (2006) Knowledge Management, , John Wiley & Sons Australia, Ltd; Davenport, T., Prusak, L., (1998) Working Knowledge How Organizations Manage What They Know, , Harvard Business School Press; Prabowo, H., (2015) Knowledge @University, , Jakarta: Binus Media & Publishing; Dalkir, K., Knowledge management (2005) Theory & Practice, , Elsevier; Grant, R.M., (2013) The Development of KM in the Oil and Gas Industry; Kulkarny, U., Louis, R.S., Organizational self assessment of knowledge management maturity (2003) Ninth Americas Conference on Information System; Tiwana, A., (1999) Knowledge Management Toolkit; Tiwana, A., (1999) Knowledge Management Toolkit, p. P102; Oil, P., Premier oil web site (2015) Strategy and Business Model, , http//www.premier-oil.com/premieroil/about/vision-and-strategy, Picked August 27, 2015, Premier Oil Vision; Alammary, J., Fung, C.C., (2008) KM Strategic Alignment in The Gulf Cooperation Council Countries
